text: Draught. Black colour, frothy brown head. Aroma is coffee, a bit of hops. Light bitterness, not sweet. Soft carbonation, medium body. Very good.

Tap (Svatovaclavsky, Olomouc)
Dark brown, small tight head. Rich roasty aroma. Sweet, some cake-tin fruitiness. Light palate, crisp carbonation. Syrupy burnt body, but not sweet, quite well attenuated. An easy drinker. Malty dark finish. Rather decent, carbonation maybe a bit high, carbonic acid even detectable in the taste. Reminds me of treacle without the sweetness.

On tap at Svatovaclavsky pivovar, Olomouc, CZ. Black with red tint, lacing. Tan to beige head. Caramel, coffee with milk, toffee. Roasty, sweet, brown sugar. Milky, soft. Roasty finish, some coffee. Very good.

10/VII/15 - on tap @ Konvikt (Olomouc) - BB: n/a (2015-902)  
Clear dark brown beer, nice solid creamy beige head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: smoky touch, roasted, coffee, cocoa powder. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body, creamy texture. Taste: pretty roasted, caramel, bit sourish, some chocolate, coffee, charcoal. Aftertaste: nice roast, coffee, some caramel, bitter touch, nice stuff, creamy finish.

On tap at brewery. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma is full of coffee, chocolate, roasted malt. Taste is medium sweet, coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate. Nice bitter roasted finish, the best they have.
Excelentní tmavé pivo. Příjemná kávově karamelová vůně, vysoká pěna, plné tělo s přiměřeným řízem a kávovou stopou na pozadí, vyí hořkost a příjemný chmelový dozvuk.
Pours in dark body with creamy head. Aroma is roasty with low chocolate. Taste has light notes of coffee, tabaco with sweet chocolate finish. Body is medium, dry with good carbonation.

En fût. Pinte dégustée directement à la brasserie. Arôme: Odeur de céréale grillée. Apparence: La couleur est noire. Présence dun énorme col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales grillée avec une pointe de vanille. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture onctueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de torréfaction en arrière goût. (Rating #4875)

On tap at Svatovaclavsky. Opaque brown black pour with a very frothy ultra lacy off-white head. Very roasty aroma, light fig/raisin aroma, coffee, stouty, very roasty flavour, light fruitiness, just a tad raisin, dry, very well attenuated, very drinkable tmave.

My Bottom Line:
This aromatic Tmavy develops roasted coffee beans in a slender body leading to roasted bitterness and a touch of citrusy tartness.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A superb head of foam thrones atop the blackness.
-The flavor profile was not as distinct as the nose.
-This brewer doesnt seem to shine with malts in the flavor profile.
-I preferred his hoppy brews, but this was still mighty fine.

On tap at the brewpub.
UPDATED: JUN 3, 2012 Tap @Olomouc. Dark brown color. Thick creamy beige head. Coffee, fruity aroma. Roasted malts, coffee beans, oily body. Papery aftertaste ruins the perfect taste.

Draught at the brewpub. Almost black, rich dense head. Roasty aroma with caramel and fudge. Sweet with pungent caramelly flavour - liquid fudge! Very soft with medium-full body. Potent and flavourful, but a bit chewy and thick.
